meaningMnemonic: An <kanji>ocean</kanji> <kanji>fish</kanji> is simply an <vocabulary>ocean fish</vocabulary>. They also happen to be the most delicious kind of fish.
readingMnemonic: You might think this is all going to be on'yomi, which it can be, but we'd actually like you to focus on the kun'yomi reading <ja>うみざかな</ja> here. Using the on'yomi is also correct, but sounds formal and scientific, while <ja>うみざかな</ja> is much more colloquial, so try to remember this reading instead! You already know the individual kun'yomi readings for this, but do watch out for the rendaku.
